brand.title: Spartans Muay Thai
brand.subtitle: Headcoach Vincent Kolek • 30 years experience
hero.eyebrow: Muay Thai for kids and adults
hero.title: Muay Thai as a way of life. Taste of Thailand in the heart of Bratislava
hero.body: Discover the art of Muay Thai under the guidance of instructor Vincent Kolek with 30 years of experience. Modern facilities, excellent accessibility with free parking and personalized approach will position you towards success from your first session.
reasons.title: Muay Thai as a Way Of Life
reasons.subtitle: A quick overview of history, health benefits, self‑defense and mindset.

reasons.items.title: Rich history and culture
reasons.items.body: Muay Thai, the 'Art of Eight Limbs', has centuries of tradition from Thailand, blending respect, discipline, and practical effectiveness.

reasons.items.title: Powerful health benefits
reasons.items.body: Full‑body training that improves conditioning, strength, mobility, and coordination while burning calories and reducing stress.

reasons.items.title: Real‑world self‑defense
reasons.items.body: Efficient strikes (punches, kicks, knees, elbows) and clinch work build confidence and practical self‑protection skills.

reasons.items.title: Discipline and mindset
reasons.items.body: Structured practice sharpens focus, resilience, and consistency that transfers to everyday life.

reasons.items.title: Do I need prior experience?
reasons.items.body: No experience required. Beginners are welcome. We scale drills to your level and focus on fundamentals first.

reasons.items.title: How often should I train?
reasons.items.body: 2–3 sessions per week is a great start. As technique and conditioning build, some athletes train 4–5x weekly.

reasons.items.title: Is Muay Thai safe?
reasons.items.body: Safety is a priority. We use proper technique, controlled drills, appropriate protective gear, and progressive intensity.

reasons.items.title: What does a class look like?
reasons.items.body: Warm‑up and mobility, technical blocks and pad work, partner drills or clinch, and an optional conditioning finisher. Cool‑down and Q&A at the end.

reasons.items.title: Age groups and inclusivity
reasons.items.body: We train kids, teens and adults. Sessions are supportive, disciplined and respectful for all skill levels.

sessions.title: Sessions
sessions.subtitle: All sessions below are personally led by {{coach}}.
sessions.gear.title: What do I need to bring to my first session?
sessions.gear.first: Just comfortable shorts, a T‑shirt and flip flops. We’ll guide you through everything else on your first visit.
